job description:
Data Scientist (Senior)
  • establish and implement end-to-end proof of concept for leading edge data mining and analytics systems
  • will be responsible for the creation of innovative methodologies for extracting key parameters from big data coming from various sensors
  • will utilize their expertise in machine learning, statistical data analytics, and predictive analytics to help implement analytics tied to cyber security and hunting methodologies and applications
*All Candidates must be a U.S. Citizen and have a TS/SCI clearance with a Full Scope Polygraph

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE
  • Shall have a Master’s degree in technical discipline (i.e. computer science, engineering mathematics, etc.); will consider candidates with a PhD and five (05) years of experience
  • Shall have six plus (06+) years of Data Scientist experience
  • Shall conduct data analysis and orchestration of a large volume of security data sources, threat indicators, and customer logs
  • Shall apply latest technologies in machine learning, data mining, and predictive analytics to correlate the big datasets and events, and derive dynamic cybersecurity rules
  • Shall generate highly accurate and near real-time security alerts based on the dynamic rules
  • Shall architect and work closely with other team members to develop a scalable cloud-based cybersecurity data analytics engine
  • Shall have experience with Applied Machine Learning experience (regression analysis, time series, probabilistic models, supervised classification and unsupervised learning)
  • Shall have a strong mathematical background (linear algebra, calculus, probability and statistics)
  • Shall have experience with JavaScript and prototyping languages such as Python and R
  • Shall be familiar with scalable distributed data processing, management, and visualization tools (e.g. Hadoop, ELK, Kafka, Accumulo, graph databases, etc.)
  • Shall be familiar with data mining and analytics methods (e.g., clustering, sequences, networks, time series, deep learning, statistical analytics, etc.)
  • Shall have knowledge of cyber security operations, cyber security data types, cyber security threats, network protocols (SOC tools and methodologies)
DESIRED EXPERIENCE
  • PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent fields is desired
